snippet: Dr. Benjamin S. Carson gave testimony in a trial in 2000 that helped persuade a jury to deny a claim made against paramedics in Baltimore for millions of dollars.
abstract: Dr Benjamin S Carson, Republican presidential hopeful, was expert witness in 2000 trial of Horace Muhammad, who was paralyzed after being tackled by Baltimore police officer in 1997; Muhammad won $2 million settlement, but Carson's testimony helped persuade jury to deny claim made against paramedics that would have resulted in much larger settlement; testimony seems oddly resonant as 2016 campaign takes place in time when nation has been shaken by series of cases in which black men have died after encounters with police.

byline.original: By STEVE EDER and PAM BELLUCK

lead_paragraph: Dr. Benjamin S. Carson gave testimony in a trial in 2000 that helped persuade a jury to deny a claim made against paramedics in Baltimore for millions of dollars.

headline.main: Before the Stump, Ben Carson Took the Stand as an Expert Witness
headline.print_headline: Long Before He Was Candidate, Carson the Surgeon Was an Expert Witness
